titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 5ra-121va) I-1) Homily by Athanasius [Timothy], Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 5ra-13rb); miracle (fols. 13rb-15ra); commemorative notice (fols. 15ra-17rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 17rb) I-2) Homily by an anonymous author for Taḫśaś (fols. 17va-24rb); miracle (fols. 24rb-26va); commemorative notice (fols. 25va-26rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 26rb) I-3) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for Ṭǝrr (fols. 26va-37rb); miracle (fols. 37rb-38rb); commemorative notice (fol. 38rb-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 38va-vb) I-4) Homily by an anonymous author for Yäkkatit (fols. 38vb-42va); miracle (fols. 42va-43vb); commemorative notice (fol. 44ra-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 44va-vb) I-5) Homily by [Severus], Metropolitan [Patriarch] of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 45ra-63va); miracle (fols. 63va-65ra); commemorative notice (fol. 65ra-rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 65rb-va) I-6) Homily by [Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox] for Miyazya (fols. 65va-70vb); miracle (fols. 70vb-73ra); commemorative notice (fol. 73ra-va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 73va-vb) I-7) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 73vb-75ra); miracle (fols. 75vb-76vb, 87ra-va); commemorative notice (fols. 87va-88ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 88ra) I-8) Homily by [Yoḥannǝs], Metropolitan of ʾAksum for [Säne] (fol. 88rb-94vb, 77ra-vb); miracle (fols. 77vb-79ra); commemorative notice (fols. 79ra-86va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 86va-vb) I-9) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs] for Ḥamle (fols. 95ra-100rb); miracle (fols. 100rb-101rb); commemorative notice (fol. 101rb-vb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 101vb) I-10) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 102ra-105vb); miracle (fols. 105vb-106vb); commemorative notice (fols. 106vb-107ra); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 107ra-rb) I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 108ra-111ra); miracle (fols. 111rb-113vb) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 114ra-118va); miracle (fols. 118va-120vb); commemorative notice (fols. 120vb-121va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 121va)
Additiones 1-3.

originlink.xlink:title: Soṭa Däbrä Sälam Qǝddus Mikaʾel / SDM

locationlink.xlink:title: Soṭa Däbrä Sälam Qǝddus Mikaʾel / SDM

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased throughout the Ms. According to Additio 1, the Ms. was donated to the church by ʾabunä Gäbrä Mikaʾel. His name and the names of his family members are written over erasures in the supplication formulas. Besides, the names of ʾArkä Sǝllus and his wife Wälättä Maryam, also written over erasures, have been preserved on some fols. (e.g., fols. 38rb, 43vb, 63va, 71ra, 111rb, 113vb) and can be deciphered in Additio 3.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. was probably resewn; the sewing is damaged. The front board is broken and repaired. Traces of leather are visible on the inner side of the front board; traces of leather or discoloration are visible also on fols. 4v and 123v. The attachment of the front board has been repaired with synthetic threads. Quire XI is misplaced, its original position must have been between quires IX and X according to the text. Many fols. are affected by humidity. Holes or tears amended on fols. 8, 43, 51.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (front board broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes and tears are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – III(8/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(10/fols. 77r-86v) – XI(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XII(8/fols. 95r-102v) – XIII(8/fols. 103r-110v) – XIV(7; s.l.: 4, stub after 3/fols. 111r-117v) – XV(6; s.l.: 2, stub after stub of 3; 3, stub after 5/fols. 118r-123v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; groups of lines (alternating with black lines) on the incipit page of Text I and of some of its sections; two initial lines of other sections and of subsections; word sälam "salutation"; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

additional.det: The note states that the Ms. was purchased and donated to the church by ʾabunä Gäbrä Mikaʾel. It mentions also his family members: his father ʾabunä Wäldä Śǝllase, mother ʿUṣǝftä Dǝngǝl, wife Wälättä Ḥǝywät, son Wäldä Mikaʾel and his sisters Ḫaylä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Mikaʾel, Wälättä Kidan.

additional.cont: Fol. 113vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Mäskäräm and ˀarke-hymn.
additional.det: The omitted commemorative notice and hymn are written in smaller, compressed script.
The note has been washed out, but the names of ʾArkä Sǝllus and his wife Wälättä Maryam can still be read.

extras.extra: - Smaller script is used on fols. 106vb-107ra, 120-121va. - A text, probably written in the same hand as Additio 3, has been erased: fols. 122ra-vb, 123rb. - Crude drawings: fols. 122v-123v. - Crude notes: fols. 28r, 102ra, 123r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months, written in the upper margin: ዘታሕሣሥ: fol. 17va ዘታሕሣሥ: fol. 26va ዘጥር: fol. 26va ዘየካቲት: fol. 38vb ዘመጋቢት: fol. 45ra ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 65va ዘግንቦት: fol. 73vb ዘሰኔ: fol. 88rb (erased).
